newsitem.title: USA: FOB Gulf Grain - Soy remains firm, corn, wheat flat.
newsitem.headline: FOB Gulf Grain - Soy remains firm, corn, wheat flat.

text.p: FOB Gulf soybeans were mostly higher on Wednesday while corn and wheat values were steady.
Dealers said export activity remained quiet but there was some interest for U.S. grains from Asia.
Two South Korean flour mills, Dongah Flour Mills Co Ltd and Cheiljedang Corp, bought a total of 23,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat from Mitsubishi Corp on Wednesday, traders said.
Shipment was set for October 25-November 25 from the Pacific Northwest to the western port city of Inchon.

Also, Taiwan's Provincial Food Bureau will tender on August 28 for a 15,470-tonne shipment of U.S. No.1 wheat, grain traders said. The shipment would be for delivery from the Pacific Northwest between October 1 to 20.
Dealers quoted the following afternoon FOB U.S. Gulf values, basis Chicago futures, except hard red winter wheat basis Kansas City. (In cents per bushel).
